title: Keg of beer

Item ID3801

A keg of beer is a large barrel of beer which can be drunk. Upon drinking it, the chatbox states, "You chug the keg. You feel reinvigorated... ...but extremely drunk, too." while the player character raises the keg above their head and chugs the entire barrel. This also causes the perspective of the player's screen to swing back and forth for a minute, as if their character is drunk. This can be stopped by teleporting.

The beer restores 15 Hitpoints, temporarily increases Strength up to 11 levels depending on the user's current level, while temporarily decreasing Attack by up to 65 levels depending on the user's current level.

A player drinking a Keg of Beer.

Kegs of beer are dropped by Dagannoths, Level 48 Black Guards in Keldagrim, and Market guards in Rellekka. It can be bought in the Rellekka Longhall for 325 coins, provided that the player has completed The Fremennik Trials quest. It can also be bought from the merchant Rasolo, who is north of Ardougne near Baxtorian Falls.

Contents

  • 1 Effects
  • 2 Item sources
    • 2.1 Shop locations
  • 3 Trivia

Effects[edit | edit source]

Stat boosts to Strength are calculated with: ⌊ L e v e l × 1 10 ⌋ + 2 {\displaystyle \lfloor Level\times {\frac {1}{10}}\rfloor +2}

Level Boost Level Boost
1-9 +2 50-59 +7
10-19 +3 60-69 +8
20-29 +4 70-79 +9
30-39 +5 80-89 +10
40-49 +6 90-99 +11

Stat boosts to Attack are calculated with: − ( ⌊ L e v e l × 1 2 ⌋ + 5 ) {\displaystyle -(\lfloor Level\times {\frac {1}{2}}\rfloor +5)}

Note that Attack level cannot be negative, so drinking a Keg of Beer with an Attack level between 1 and 10 will temporarily debuff the Attack level to 0. At level 99, Attack will be lowered down to level 45.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • Beer kegs are also one of the few edible items that have a unique consumption animation. Unlike most drinks, when a player drinks a beer keg they can be seen tipping the barrel back with both hands.
  • When the player attempts to drink a keg of beer whilst on the Fishing Trawler, they will receive a message saying "With my sea sickness? You must be joking!"

[[File:Keg of beer detail.png|left|100px]]
A '''keg of beer''' is a large barrel of [[beer]] which can be drunk. Upon drinking it, the chatbox states, "You chug the keg. You feel reinvigorated... ...but extremely drunk, too." while the player character raises the keg above their head and chugs the entire [[barrel]]. This also causes the perspective of the player's screen to swing back and forth for a minute, as if their character is drunk. This can be stopped by [[teleporting]].

The beer restores 15 [[Hitpoints]], temporarily increases [[Strength]] up to 11 levels depending on the user's current level, while temporarily decreasing [[Attack]] by up to 65 levels depending on the user's current level.
[[File:Keg of beer.gif|150px|left|thumb|A player drinking a Keg of Beer.]]
Kegs of beer are dropped by [[Dagannoth]]s, Level 48 [[Black Guard]]s in [[Keldagrim]], and [[Market Guard (Fremennik)|Market guards]] in [[Rellekka]]. It can be bought in the [[Rellekka]] Longhall for 325 coins, provided that the player has completed [[The Fremennik Trials]] quest. It can also be bought from the merchant [[Rasolo]], who is north of [[Ardougne]] near [[Baxtorian Falls]].

Stat boosts to Strength are calculated with: <math>\lfloor Level \times \frac{1}{10} \rfloor + 2</math>

Stat boosts to Attack are calculated with: <math> -(\lfloor Level \times \frac{1}{2} \rfloor + 5)</math>

Note that Attack level cannot be negative, so drinking a Keg of Beer with an Attack level between 1 and 10 will temporarily debuff the Attack level to 0.
At level 99, Attack will be lowered down to level 45.

==Trivia==
* Beer kegs are also one of the few edible items that have a unique consumption animation. Unlike most drinks, when a player drinks a beer keg they can be seen tipping the barrel back with both hands.
* When the player attempts to drink a keg of beer whilst on the [[Fishing Trawler]], they will receive a message saying "With my sea sickness? You must be joking!"
